text: Zagorsk Pumped Storage Station (Russian: Заго́рская гидроаккумули́рующая электроста́нция) is a pumped-storage hydroelectric power station near Sergiev Posad, Russia. Zagorsk-1 has a installed capacity and was Russia's first power plant of that type. The project was approved in 1974, the first two generators operational in 1987 and the rest by 2000. Zagorsk-2 with a future installed capacity of 840 MW is currently being constructed adjacent to it. == See also == * List of power stations in Russia ==References== Category:Energy infrastructure completed in 1987 Category:Energy infrastructure completed in 2000 Category:Hydroelectric power stations in Russia Category:Pumped-storage hydroelectric power stations Category:Hydroelectric power stations built in the Soviet Union
title: Zagorsk Pumped Storage Station
